result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Erik William Nielsen

defendant.name: Nielsen, Erik William
defendant.address: 1324 S Emmertsen Rd, Mount Pleasant, WI 53406

records.addlTxt: State's Notice of Intent to introduce Deft's statements

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: DA AUTHORIZATION TO OBTAIN COPIES OF CERTAIN EVIDENCE

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. No contact with Pick n Save stores and Festival food stores.

1:41 PM Defendant Erik William Nielsen appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Juan Sebastian Ramirez appeared by video for Erik William Nielsen.  Prosecuting attorney Jacob Nelson Garman appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, not guilty plea entered, bond set.
Status conference scheduled for January 23, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on January 23, 2023 at 08:30 am.

Initial appearance on October 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing being held via video and telephone conferencing. You may view this hearing by using the following link:  https://www.wicourts.gov/courts/livestream.htm, Racine County, Judicial Court Commissioner
